default-index-error:title: ot-acl-index:header
ERROR!:
Access Roles provide a simple approach to managing user access within the application. Roles are created by any user with access, allowing them to grant and revoke access to certain resources within the application.

Below are all active roles that are available to be assigned to users:

default-index-error:title: ot-acl-details:defaultRoleNeedsAccess
ERROR!: The default role (%1$s) does not have access to ot_api. The API will not work correctly until access is granted to the default role (%1$s).

default-index-error:title: ot-acl-details:header
ERROR!: These are the individual details for the %1$s access role as they appear in the actual ACL configuration file.

default-index-error:title: ot-acl-details:applicationAccess:header
ERROR!: These are the access rules for this role within the application.

default-index-error:title: ot-acl-details:remoteAccess:header
ERROR!: These are the access rules for this role when someone is accessing this application remotely.

default-index-error:title: ot-acl-add:header
ERROR!: Select the name that you would like to call the role.  This system also allows roles to inherit permission from an existing role.  Inhertance is optional but is useful in implementing a tiered access system.

default-index-error:title: ot-acl-edit:header
ERROR!: Select the name that you would like to call the role.  This system also allows roles to inherit permission from an existing role.  Inhertance is optional but is useful in implementing a tiered access system.

default-index-error:title: ot-trigger-index:header
ERROR!:
Triggers are actionable events taken by the application. For example, the adding of a new user account or resetting of a password. When a trigger is fired, you can register certain events to happen, such as sending of an email or posting of a tweet.

The following triggers are available for you to execute an action on.
